content: I just got off the phone with a firm selling life insurance called Countrywide. They wanted to sell me and my wife hospital insurance. I listened for a moment or two than he wanted to confirm my address, date of birth and my place of birth. I lied and gave him my right home address but not my date and place of birth. He then connected me to a woman to confirm what info I just gave him. As she was talking I was actually reading a post on here. When she was through talking she asked me if I understood and I told her I was sorry that I was trying to listen to her and watch porn movies at the same time. I heard a loud click. I never hang up on these people. I always play with them to waste their time. To them time is money and to waste it for me is really fun. How about you all?
reply: I just got off the phone with a firm selling life insurance called Countrywide. They wanted to sell me and my wife hospital insurance. content: I KEEP RIGHT ON ASKING QUESTIONS AND THEN SAY JUST A MOMENT, SOMEONE IS AT THE DOOR. I COME BACK IN A FEW MINUTES . IF THEY ARE STILL THERE I ASK THEM TO REPEAT THEMSELVES AND ASK AWAY AT THEM WITH QUESTIONS. I GET ONE FOR DRIVE TRAIN INS. ALL THE TIME.

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: Mike, I ask them not to call again and to take me off their call lists and their business partner's distribution lists...sometimes it works, sometimes it does not. Also, Google: "harrassing telemarketer murder scene", click on the first entry, and listen to the recording...one of my favorites. Have a good one, Don

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: My favorite is when they come to the door, selling relgion. Sorry if I'm about to offend anyone, NAW sccrew that, God shouldn't be sold door to door like Fuller Brushes. I have 2 fun time with these people, the first is when I ws on AD, I had rented a house with 4 other people. On was a married couple, on day these two sweet little old ladies came to give us a copy oof the Watch Tower. My friend and hs wife invited them in. His proceeds to tell them we're all her husband and we "share" her on a rotaing basis. Furhtermore, were all devil worshippers and invited them to aprtake in a black mass. My buddy,Mike ws in the next room. Hearing all this, porceeds to chalk a pentagram on the table and place candles on the table. He then opens up the louvres that seperated the room and intones "all is ready". The ladies HASTILY declined and left rather hurriedely .... My second encounter, I was out of the Navy by then. My friend and I were tweaking my computer. My wife was at work and he brought his kids by to play with mine. We had ordered pizza, abit later we heard a ringing of the door bell. At first we thougth it was the pizza delivery, but alas, it was a husband and wife team. Without saying a word, we decided to work these to over. I went into a big aethis rant about the Bible is make believe, ya,da, ya, da, ya, da .... My buddy ws talking to the woman about how he was on a Spritual quest, looking for meaning ect., ect, ect.... ANyways, the pizza shows up and I look at him and say, "Hon, the pizza is here, can you call the kids?" With out missing a beat ha say "Sure sweetine, no problem". They left quiclkly, with out taking back thier Watch Tower mag ....

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - - Wandering and Wondering

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - - We don't answer the land line either; however, if we do answer by accident, we try to remember that the telemarketer is probably just trying to keep a job and support their family. Someone mentioned the "watchtower" people. We had a couple groups show up over the years. They were very neatly dressed and respectful. Never would they come in to the house, but sometimes they would accept a glass of water or tea. I figured that since they went to all the trouble of coming way out here, past the cows, braving the loose dogs...the least I could do is offer them a drink especially on those hot Texas summer days. "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - -
reply: We don't answer the land line either; however, if we do answer by accident, we try to remember that the telemarketer is probably just trying to keep a job and support their family. Someone mentioned the "watchtower" people. We had a couple groups show up over the years. They were very neatly dressed and respectful. Never would they come in to the house, but sometimes they would accept a glass of water or tea. I figured that since they went to all the trouble of coming way out here, past the cows, braving the loose dogs...the least I could do is offer them a drink especially on those hot Texas summer days. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: While they're rambling, I say loudly, Hey,Hey. And they go yes ma'am? I say: let me know if you hear a 'click"-O.k.? They say o.k. Then I hang -up........

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: Can't remember the last time a salesman called. I wish they would put politicians on the no-call list. I get the occasional call from a charity or survey, but no sales calls.

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: Originally posted by SinePariDonster: Also, Google: "harrassing telemarketer murder scene", click on the first entry, and listen to the recording...one of my favorites. Tom Mabe. This guy is funny, funny funny. He has CD's out of nothing but prank phone calls. Of telemarketers that call him. A frequent guest of Bob and Tom. Good stuff! I'm on the "Do Not Call List." However, some get through. Somehow... I just say, "Not interested" and slam the phone down. Which is kind of hard to do now considering you press a button to hang up these days. Doesn't have the same anger value.
quote: Originally posted by SinePariDonster: Also, Google: "harrassing telemarketer murder scene", click on the first entry, and listen to the recording...one of my favorites.
reply: Tom Mabe. This guy is funny, funny funny. He has CD's out of nothing but prank phone calls. Of telemarketers that call him. A frequent guest of Bob and Tom. Good stuff! I'm on the "Do Not Call List." However, some get through. Somehow... I just say, "Not interested" and slam the phone down. Which is kind of hard to do now considering you press a button to hang up these days. Doesn't have the same anger value.
title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - - Wandering and Wondering

title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - We did the same thing. We went with Cingular<SP> and always get really good service though Cingular was taken over by AT&T. We even got to keep our old land line number. The only problem is that I do computer repair and once in a while a computer comes in that still runs into a phone line. When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - - How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - We did the same thing. We went with Cingular<SP> and always get really good service though Cingular was taken over by AT&T. We even got to keep our old land line number. The only problem is that I do computer repair and once in a while a computer comes in that still runs into a phone line. When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - -
reply: How come I pressed "One for English" and still can't understand a word the dude is saying?
title: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home?

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - - We don't answer the land line either; however, if we do answer by accident, we try to remember that the telemarketer is probably just trying to keep a job and support their family. Someone mentioned the "watchtower" people. We had a couple groups show up over the years. They were very neatly dressed and respectful. Never would they come in to the house, but sometimes they would accept a glass of water or tea. I figured that since they went to all the trouble of coming way out here, past the cows, braving the loose dogs...the least I could do is offer them a drink especially on those hot Texas summer days. "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard
quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: quote: What do you all do when telemarketers call your home? They can't!! We don't have a landline telephone any more. And it saves us about $40.00 a month - - When we did have regular telephone, we had caller ID. If it wasn't some one I knew I'd just pick up the receive and set it back down, or let it go to the answering machine that had a recording something like this: "Hi we're not home right now, so leave a message, unless your a salesman - then you can talk to Rosco...Here Rosco!...Woof! WOOOOOOF! Wooof! Woof! WOOOOOOF! Woof!" Click - - -
reply: We don't answer the land line either; however, if we do answer by accident, we try to remember that the telemarketer is probably just trying to keep a job and support their family. Someone mentioned the "watchtower" people. We had a couple groups show up over the years. They were very neatly dressed and respectful. Never would they come in to the house, but sometimes they would accept a glass of water or tea. I figured that since they went to all the trouble of coming way out here, past the cows, braving the loose dogs...the least I could do is offer them a drink especially on those hot Texas summer days. "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard
